source.citation: Harvey, A. 1982. Evaluation of Barko 450 Loader. FERIC Technical Note TN-46.
notes: Loader: Barko 450 knuckle-boom with live-heel grapple on Chaptrac 500 undercarriage (Weldco XG-125 grapple).
Study compares performance in a grapple-skidded pine block vs. a hand-felled, Washington 78 yarder block (central processing yard).
Main utilisation losses were waiting for trucks, moving between decks, and sorting/log-deck preparation.
Improving truck supply or staging more decks could raise utilisation above 80% without hardware changes.

scenarios.name: ground_skid_block
scenarios.description: Interior lodgepole pine block with grapple-skidded roadside decks (Cat 966C replaced by Barko).
notes: 32-day period, 20.5 million kg translated to 21,057 m³ (349 off-highway loads).
Daily production limited by available skidded wood (~12 loads ≈700 m³/day).

scenarios.name: cable_yard_block
scenarios.description: Hand-felled, Washington 78 yarder setting with full trees piled roadside; loader streams onto off-highway trucks.
notes: Average tree size ≈0.8 m³; loader kept pace with yarder-delivered decks.
Daily output effectively capped by truck dispatch (≈11 loads/day).
